page.title: 10QUARRINGTON RIDING SCHOOL
page.content:
The owner of the{riding school}is Tessa Brown. Sue Mallinson is the head girl. The school is used by girls, women, and occasionally some boys. It opened about 10 years ago.
There are 24{horses.}At 7.45 Sue Mallinson feeds the horses and mucks out the yard. She brings the horses in from the fields so they do not get ill from eating too much grass. Then she rides the horses to exercise them. In the afternoon the horses are groomed and their hooves are polished with hoof oil. The tack has to be cleaned. The horses are tacked up for the {lessons}at 4.30 and 5.30. After the lessons the horses are untacked, and taken to their stables to be fed. Occasionally they have a shampoo, and their coats and tails are clipped.
